locale_welcome_message.message:
TODO translate To get started, select a server* and log in with your username and password.
If you do not have an account yet, click on the Register button.

Tips:
  • Save your work often.
  • To get your most up-to-date auto-glossing rules, refresh your browser window after you save your data.
  • Check out our FAQ for more!

*If you are unsure as to which server to select, chances are your account is located on the LingSync server.

locale_create_account_question.message: TODO translate How do I create an account?

locale_create_account_answer.message: TODO translate From the main startup screen, click the 'Register' button in the top right corner and fill out the form. If you are unsure as to which server you should select, you most likely want to choose 'LingSync'.

locale_create_corpus_question.message: TODO translate How do I create a corpus?

locale_create_corpus_answer.message: TODO translate After you have logged in, hover over 'Settings' and select 'Corpus'. From this page, you can add a new corpus.

locale_enter_data_question.message: TODO translate How do I enter data?

locale_enter_data_answer.message: TODO translate After you have selected a corpus and an elicitation session (or created a new session), you will be taken to the data entry page. The topmost item on this page is the space to enter new records. Fill in your data and/or record/upload audio and then click 'Create New'. Note that your new record will not be saved to the database until you click the 'Save' button at the top right of the screen!

locale_import_data_question.message: TODO translate How do I import data?

locale_import_data_answer.message: TODO translate You can import entire Elicitation Session by uploading an audio/video (any format works: .wav, .aiff, .mp3, .ogg, .mov, .avi, .3gp, .mp4 etc) (how-to video) or text data (csv, plain text, TextGrid, toolbox and more) (how-to video) using the Prototype app. These import functionality will be moved to the corpus admin pages when it becomes a priority.
locale_import_data_answer.description: answer contains href links which seem to screw up json message format, so I leave it empty for the moment

locale_audio_upload_limit_question.message: TODO translate How much audio/video can I upload?

locale_audio_upload_limit_answer.message: TODO translate We set the limit at 1.5GB. If this is too low for you, you probably are doing a lot with audio/video and maybe even your department has a server that you can install the audio service on so that you dont have to use the LingSync.org resources. If you will have a lot of heavy video files (more than 300MB) you can also consider using a private or unlisted videos on YouTube, SoundCloud, Google drive or even your department's servers to host the files online.

locale_edit_record_question.message: TODO translate How do I edit an existing record?

locale_edit_record_answer.message: TODO translate Single-click anywhere on the record you wish to edit. This will make the record editable. Make your changes and click the 'Done' button. Note that changes to this record will not be saved to the database until you click the 'Save' button!

locale_record_upload_comment_question.message: TODO translate How do I record audio, upload audio, or add/view comments?

locale_record_upload_comment_answer.message:
TODO translate Click the expand button on a new record or a record in edit mode to access audio and comment features. You may click the collapse button to hide this section.

Recording Audio
To record audio, click the record button. Note that you must then click the 'Allow' button on the browser dropdown at the top of the page. Your audio will begin recording once you click 'Allow'. To stop recording, simply click the 'Recording' button. Your audio will then be processed. This may take a while.

Uploading Audio
To upload audio files, click on 'Choose files' and select one or more audio files from your hard drive. Audio files may be in .wav, .mp3, or .ogg format.

Adding/Deleting Comments
To add a comment, click on the 'Add a comment' link and enter your comment in the popup box. To delete a comment, click on the 'X' next to the comment. You may only delete your own comments. Comments are not editable, so to change what your comment says simply delete it and write a new one.

locale_delete_record_question.message: TODO translate How do I delete a record or audio file?

locale_delete_record_answer.message: TODO translate To delete a record, click the relevant record and then click the 'Delete' button. To delete an audio file, click on the 'X' next to the file. In both cases, you will be prompted to verify the deletion. Note that deleting records and files only a flag and does not result in destroying data.

locale_privacy_question.message: TODO translate Is my data private and protected?

locale_privacy_answer.message: TODO translate Yes! For more on our policies with respect to your data, please see our web site.

locale_export_question.message: TODO How do I export data?

locale_export_answer.message:
TODO tranalate You can export your entire database as csv (warning, csv is a lossy format, don't use this for backing up your data), or backup your data as non-lossy json. You can also share your data with other people by adding them to your corpus, or you can make parts of your corpus public and sharable on your corpus' own webpage You can also export lists of data in LaTeX among other things using the Prototype app.

You can also download a word list, glossed word list and a morphemes list, among other things. If you're curious about other exports you can do, contact us and one of the current students will give you a tutorial. Exporting data from LingSync.org is extremely powerful and flexible.
locale_export_answer.description: links screw up the json format so i leave it empty for the moment

locale_contact_answer.message: TODO translate For any other questions or comments, you may send us an email or ask other users on Facebook.
locale_contact_answer.description: links screw up the json format so I leave it empty for the moment
